title: Man Shot 15 Times:Man Who Was Shot 15 Times Walks His Way To Hospital Emergency Room & Is Miraculously Going To Survive
text:
After Being Shot 15 Times, This Man Walked His Way To The Emergency Room & Is Now Expected To Survive

After Being Shot 15 Times, This Man Walked His Way To The Emergency Room & Is Now Expected To Survive

In a shocking, incident a man who suffered a whopping 15 gun shots gathered the courage to walk his way to the hospital to get treated and his going to survive.

According to Philadelphia police the shooting took place on the 1700 block of Tilghman Street, in the city's Kensington section.

Twitter/nbcdfw.com

The cops found 23 spent shell casings from large caliber bullets on the scene but the victim was nowhere to be found.

'For him to be hit that many times throughout his body... and he walked into the hospital. That's pretty miraculous,' Police Chief Inspector Scott Small told CBS Philadelphia.

Don't Miss 26.4 K SHARES 12.4 K SHARES 30.7 K SHARES 2.9 K SHARES 5 K SHARES

The man was shot five times on his right side, twice to his left hip, three times to his upper chest, once to his right shoulder, once to the right side of his neck, and four to his forearms, Philadelphia Inquirer reported.

Twitter/nbcdfw.com

“It sounded like on TV. I mean, it was loud as hell," a witness who heard the gun shots told reporters. The corner where the shooting took place is somewhat isolated by warehouses and people hardly go that side.

The 27-year-old had undergone surgery and is in critical condition, but is now expected to survive. Police will be checking the numerous surveillance cameras near the crime scene for any footage of the shooting.

According to Philadelphia police the shooting took place on the 1700 block of Tilghman Street, in the city's Kensington section.
